data.question: What is the chemical formula of the dense MOF discussed?
At what temperature does the proton conductivity of the dense MOF abruptly increase?
What is the activation energy for proton conduction in the dense MOF?
Is the transformation from phase I to phase II of the dense MOF reversible?
Does the dense MOF exhibit a humidity-induced phase transition?
What method was used to measure the proton conductivities?
What is the role of humidity in the proton conductivity of the dense MOF?
data.answer: Humidity triggers a phase transition that increases proton conductivity.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of the dense MOF stable overnight?
What is the crystal system of phase I of the dense MOF?
What triggers the transformation from phase I to phase III of the dense MOF?
Does the structure of the dense MOF return to phase I after drying?
What is the space group of phase II of the dense MOF?
What analysis method was used to determine the crystal structure of the dense MOF?
What is the role of water molecules in the proton conductivity of the dense MOF?
data.answer: Water molecules act as proton carriers.

data.question: Is the transformation from phase II to phase III of the dense MOF reversible?
What is the solvent accessible volume (SAV) percentage of phase I?
What is the effect of increasing relative humidity (RH) on the proton conductivity of the dense MOF?
data.answer: Increasing RH to 67% results in an abrupt increase in proton conductivity.

data.question: Does the dense MOF's proton conductivity depend on the presence of free water molecules?
What is the chemical composition of phase II of the dense MOF?
What is the significance of the activation energy in the context of the dense MOF's proton conductivity?
data.answer: The high activation energy suggests that protons transport through the framework and/or micropores, not through free water molecules.
